TLINE.TDLINE: &USE&
Ø,,The dynamic appendix includes non-monetary agreements and checklists.
They are used to display all agreements which cannot be expressed
through monetary conditions. The non-monetary agreements refer to
contracts, the checklists refer to entire agreements (VU).
Ø,,Dynamic appendixes can be defined per contract type and
organizational level. It is possible to define check boxes and text
fields, tables, combo boxes and radio buttons.
&PRECONDITIONS&
&STANDARD_SETUP&
&ACTIVITY&
The maintenance takes place via the SM34, the view cluster maintenance.
Via the /GICOM/VC_TDYN you access directly into the dynamic appendix
maintenance.
Dynamic Appendix SM34 maintenance
A Dynamic appendix relation consists of maximum 3 levels. The upper
level is always a frame which is displayed as an expandable panel in the
interface. Below, three options for the structure of the dynamic
appendixes are provided.
1) The lower level includes further subheadings (second level) with
individual fields (checkboxes, text fields, radio buttons, combo box
fields, and description fields).
2) This is followed by individual dynamic appendix fields.
3) Tables with individual columns may follow, where the second level is
represented by the table itself and the third level is represented by
the table columns. Table columns can be defined as free text, combo box
or checkbox.
The three options can be combined under any panel frame, but you should
always include all 3 levels. Further information will follow.
Step1: Definition table
The individual dynamic appendixes are defined via the view cluster
„/GICOM/VC_TDYN“.
Each dynamic appendix has a clear ID. For this purpose, technical
parameters must be maintained which affect/control the display and
performance on the maintenance screen.
Below a detailed description is provided of the parameters to be entered
for the dynamic appendix definition:
Definition of dynamic appendix
Ø,,Dyn ID: Here, a clear ID with a maximum of 10 characters is entered.
The ID is a character key which is selected freely. It is recommended to
define the dynamic appendix with sequential IDs, if they belong to one
panel/block. This facilitates maintenance. To allow the addition of new
text fields, table columns, etc. for the block in the number range at a
later stage, we recommend to leave some IDs empty at the start of the ID
range in the next set.
Ø,,Value Help ID: A value help can be defined directly in the view
cluster maintenance (see Chapter 3.9.7). This can be deposited here with
their ID. However, you must define the value help before it is saved in
the dynamic appendix, because otherwise these cannot be saved.
Ø,,Field type: Here you define a Frame (FR), a Text field (TF), a
Checkbox (CB), a Table (TB), a Table Column (TC) a Radio button (RB), a
Long text (LT) or a Description field (DF). Initially, you define a
frame for each panel/each block (upper level).
Ø,,Table name and field Name: In both fields you enter a combination of
a table name and field (for example: LFA1/LIFNR). Next, you define the
corresponding dynamic appendix with regards to its data type, length,
description and F4-help per the specified reference.
Ø,,Data type: Defines the data type of the dynamic appendix. The
following data types are available: - DDIC: DDIC reference is selected
for frames, checkboxes and tables. - CHAR: You select a character field
for text fields or table columns, where free text should be possible -
NUMC: You select a number field for text fields or table columns, in
which only numbers can be entered.
-,,DATS: A date field can be selected for text fields or table columns,
in which only dates can be entered. In this definition, a calendar is
deposited as a value help for dynamic appendix maintenance
-,,DEC: A decimal field can be selected for text fields or table
columns.
Ø,,Length: This field defines the number of positions of the Dynamic
Annexes that can be entered in the field with either the data types
CHAR, DATS, NUMC and DEC. (Accordingly, a dynamic appendix with the data
type DATS must contain 10 positions, because the dots are also counted.)
Ø,,Decimal digits: If you select the data type DEC, you must define the
number of decimal positions behind the comma in this field. Also, the
field "Length of characters" must consider the decimal positions, which
means that the additional decimal positions already should have been
included. If the data type is not DEC, leave this field empty.
Ø,,Search Help: For text fields and table columns a DDIC search help can
be deposited.
Ø,,Feature Combo box: This feature is activated if the value help is
displayed in the form of a combo box (as a drop-down view), instead of a
separate pop-up with search function. Complete this field only, when
there is an entry in the field "Value Help".
Ø,,Feature checkbox: This field is activated when a field must contain a
checkbox.
Ø,,Check type: Dynamic appendix fields can be declared as required
fields, thus as mandatory fields. If these Dynamic appendixes are not
entered in the contract, the contract variant cannot be released and an
error report will be transmitted. Mandatory fields are marked with a red
star in the dialog. Panels containing more than one mandatory dynamic
appendix are also marked with a red star indicating the number of
mandatory dynamic appendixes.
Ø,,Further entry types are: - No limitations
-,,Optional field But at the moment, they have no effect on the
processes.
Ø,,Text object ID: A dynamic appendix can be assigned to a SAP long text
object. If a long text object is deposited, the maintenance screen will
show the template which is drawn from the long text object. Long text
objects must be defined in the transaction SO10.
Ø,,Maximum number of columns: If a dynamic appendix is defined as a
table, it is possible to define a pre-defined number of visible columns
for the maintenance screen. If more columns are created, these will be
faded out. Via the layout-function these can be faded in again.
Step2: Definition - texts
The field identifiers for the individual dynamic appendixes is directly
performed in the view cluster maintenance.
Text definition
·,,New entries can be made when you select an entry for which a
designation must be entered. By clicking on the subordinate column
„Definition text you can enter a 100 character designation in the
corresponding language as desired. The identifier is then displayed in
the dialog per the log-in language of the user. You can make entries for
as many languages as desired.
·,,Caution! A dynamic appendix ID which was used productively, but is of
no longer in use should never be re-used with another designation or
definition elsewhere. This may lead to discrepancies because the
designations and definitions have no validity, so that any modification
would also lead to a modification of the definition in the older
agreements.
Step3: Sets
The maintenance of a dynamic appendix set is performed via this view
cluster. You create an ID and provide it with a validity period. Next,
enter a type to determine the type of dynamic appendix (non-monetary
agreement or checklist).
Set definition of a dynamic appendix
Dynamic appendix - sets
Set Id Title
Step4: Relations
The relations between the individual dynamic appendix and their
structure and arrangement in the dialog is defined via the view cluster.
You select the set in the column „sets for which the relations should be
defined.
Selection of the desired Set
When relations are created the parent-child relation between the dynamic
appendixes are displayed. As mentioned, in total only three levels are
featured.
The Dynamic appendixes are read from the tables in the dialog during
runtime and generated and displayed accordingly (text fields, radio
buttons, etc.).
In the relation table<(>,<)> you enter the so-called parent-child
relations.
A frame which is at the first level has always an "empty" parent and is
maintained in the second column where the children are created. This
frame appears in the dialog as a column or panel which can be expanded
with a click.
·,,Set ID: The dynamic appendixes are grouped per the chosen set ID. One
set can contain several panels. Both the panels and their subordinate
dynamic appendix must be maintained beneath the same set-ID, in order
for them to be displayed together. One dynamic appendix can be used in
several Sets.
·,,Parent ID: The parent ID defines the superordinate element
·,,Child ID: The child ID defines the subordinate element
·,,Row: Dynamic appendixes can be positioned by marking a row in the
desired vertical row sequence in the maintenance dialog. It is important
to consider that the entry is always viewed in relation to the higher
·,,"Parent", thus it determines the row sequence within a Parent. Under
each Parent the number sequence must be restarted with "1". The rows
take also the panels with empty PARENT_ID to a corresponding sequence.
·,,Column: Column sequences are defined for table columns within a
table. You can position a description field behind another element.
Step5: Relation sets
The relation sets of a dynamic appendix can be entered via the view
cluster. Here you assign a previously entered set ID to a business
object type and a corresponding application type ID. Initially, you
select the desired set ID. This gives you access to the relations sets.
You can select between the business object types /GICOM/V02 (contract)
and /GICOM/V08 (negotiation round). Besides, the individual IDs of the
respective types are entered. This defines the set of dynamic appendixes
that apply to the contract or negotiation round types.
To illustrate: in the assignment above the dynamic appendix with the Set
ID 1 is assigned to the application types 10, 30 and 40.
Step6: Value Helps
The mentioned auto-defined value helps for the dynamic appendix and
their language-dependent designations are maintained via the view
cluster.
By clicking the button „new entries the following maintenance screen is
opened:
-,,Value help: The ID of the value help can be entered, which is also
saved in the dynamic appendix. It is recommended to create the value
help ID analogous to the dynamic appendix ID, to see the connection
directly in case modifications are implemented.
-,,Key: The second field contains a value key, which can be selected in
the dynamic appendix. The key does not dependent on the language.
-,,Language key: The value helps must be created per language. You also
need to enter the language of the created value support in this field.
-,,Title: The designation of the value is saved according to the
language, which must be indicated in the value help.
&EXAMPLE&
